benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid payload scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) are covered, exercising single/multiple tag additions and post-success verification.
Error handling for invalid payloads: malformed JSON (TC09), empty tag list (TC10), invalid tag definition UUIDs (TC11), and extra/unsupported parameters (TC12).
Header and authorization validations: missing required header (TC06) and unauthorized access (TC16).
Resource existence checks: non-existent invoice item (TC08) and invalid invoice item id format (TC07) covered, as well as scenario with no invoice items (TC15).
Security and data integrity: malicious payload (TC18) and duplicate tag definitions handling (TC13, TC20) covered; regression for not duplicating existing tags.
Edge cases and validation: empty/incomplete inputs like partial inputs (TC24), extremely large payloads (TC19), heavy load scenario (TC14), and timeouts (TC25).
State and concurrency variations: already-present tags (TC04) and state variations (TC22, TC23).
Dependency and service availability: tag-definition service down (TC21) and overall KillBill service down (TC17).
gaps: Internal server error (500) scenarios not explicitly tested.
Authorization failure with 403 forbidden not covered (only 401 is tested).
Rate limiting / throttling scenarios are not tested.
Concurrency edge cases beyond duplicates (e.g., race conditions on parallel updates) not covered.
recommendations: Add a test for 500 Internal Server Error to validate server error handling.
Add a 403 Forbidden test where user authenticated but lacks permissions.
Add rate limiting tests to ensure proper throttling under high load.
Add tests validating caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) and conditional requests.
Expand concurrency testing to cover race conditions when multiple clients update the same invoice item tags simultaneously.
